metadata.title: CASE 462/04: Investigation on Bribery and Favouritism in Procurement by Pristina Airport
metadata.primary_source: United Nations Interim Administration Mission in Kosovo

overview: An investigation report by the United Nations Interim Administration Mission in Kosovo into alleged bribery and favoritism in the procurement of uniforms at Pristina Airport.

applicable_laws.excerpt: Avoidance of Conflicts of Interest and Corruption

methodology.description: The methodology included interviews with key personnel and review of procurement documents including bid records, tender process documentation, and related administrative communications.

background.context: The investigation pertains to allegations of bribery and procedural violations in the procurement process at Pristina Airport as reported by an internal memorandum from the Kosovo Trust Agency's Internal Audit Unit.

investigation_details.subject: Alleged bribery and favoritism in procurement

allegations.description: Procurement Officer 1 and Finance Officer allegedly accepted bribes from Vendor 2.
allegations.findings: No evidence was found to support the allegation of accepting bribes from Vendor 2.

allegations.description: Procurement Officer 1 allegedly replaced a Bid Evaluation Committee member.
allegations.findings: The replacement of the committee member was reasonable and not for ulterior motives.

allegations.description: Procurement Officer 1 inappropriately included the Finance Officer in the Bid Evaluation Committee.
allegations.findings: The inclusion of the Finance Officer was not unprofessional, nor was it prohibited by regulations.

allegations.description: Procurement Officer 1 favored Vendor 2 in the tender process.
allegations.findings: No evidence was found of favoritism towards Vendor 2.
The assertion of a threat was not substantiated.

allegations.description: Vendor 1 Manager’s utterances constituted a threat against Procurement Officer 1.
allegations.findings: The alleged threat by Vendor 1 Manager was unsubstantiated.

findings: No bribery or inappropriate conduct by Procurement Officer 1 or the Finance Officer was substantiated.
The procurement process adhered to regulatory guidelines, without evidence of favoritism or bias.

actions: It is recommended that UNMIK Pillar IV inform Procurement Officer 1 and the Finance Officer, as well as the KTA Internal Audit Unit, that the ITF did not find any wrongdoing on the part of Procurement Officer 1 or the Finance Officer. (IV04/462/01)

It is recommended that UNMIK provide this report to both the Department of Justice and the Financial Investigation Unit for information purposes, to assist with current investigations related to alleged payments of 'kickbacks' at Pristina Airport. (IV04/462/02)
